title.narrative: Providing secure shelter for the most vulnerable people through emergency rehabilitation of houses in Afrin, Bazagha, Qabasin and Al-Bab communities.

description.narrative: The project’s proposed interventions seek to improve the humanitarian situation for the recent war-affected population from Idleb and West Rural of Aleppo by implementing light rehabilitation of 1,250 houses in (Afrin, Bazagha, Qabasin and Al Bab communities), that will be able to provide more security and privacy to the inhabitants in response to the increasing demand in the overburdened communities as a result of the continuous arrival of tens of thousands of forcefully displaced people due to escalation. 7,500 IDPs will be benefited directly from the rehabilitation intervention. Coordination with local councils, SNFI cluster, and other active actors in the targeted area is the first mandatory step for all outputs 1,250 houses are rehabilitated with light rehabilitation activity ($350.00 per house), in Afrin (550 HHs), Bazagha (100 HHs), Qabasin (100 HHs) and Al Bab (500 HHs). The rehabilitation activities will include: - Ensuring internal living spaces’ security and privacy by providing closed, sealed and independent environments for the HHs, by maintaining\providing of doors and windows with different material option (PVC, Iron, Wood or Aluminum) to ensure the most secure and private environment for the inhabitant family against bad weather conditions (Rain, Snow, Cold ..etc.), security threads or thievery and privacy conditions (indoor separators). - Ensure the maximum beneficiaries' safety by implementing minor rehabilitation works such as fixing the entrance for safer access to the shelter with the needed ramps/handrailing for PWDs if needed. - Ensuring a healthier environment by promoting the hygiene and maintaining the WASH facilities in the house, this activity will include rehabilitation of WCs and bathrooms (maintenance of old items and/or providing of new items such as water taps, faucets, water mixers, sinks, toilets, walls\floors ceramics, etc.) - Providing illumination and a light power source in each room by providing the needed electrical points (lamps, switches, wires, etc.) and connect them to the local power source. - Ensuring better living conditions for people with special needs by providing special architectural elements (light in entrance, metal grips and handles, metal railings, special needs people suitable toilets /squat toilet/, concrete ramps in entrance, etc.) IRD will target IDPs households in the shelter repair activity, those who live in inadequate shelter, especially where minimum SPHERE standards are not met (3.5m2/individual) Only houses with a light level of damage/unfinished building will be targeted, the houses with damaged structural elements will be not, and thus will be excluded. Since IRD is targeting houses with light rehabilitation, it will not interfere with any action that might change the house’s specifications, as the cluster rehabilitation guidelines the works fall under Grade 1, IRD can target the houses with a budget under 400$ with no constructional works, as long as the BNF’s approval on the terms of assistance is provided and the MoU with the LC is signed. IRD will sign a coordination document with the households to ensure their right to stay inhabitant in the shelter for at least one year after the date of the rehabilitation work completion. Coordination at all levels and with all stakeholders will be continuous throughout the project duration, and the implementation will be monitored and eventually evaluated to ensure the best application of the implementation methods and to gradually improve work quality. Implementation Plan attached ANNEX 01 IRD coordinated with Bonyan Organization which declared its intention to target Afrin community with a rehabilitation activity, IRD and Bonyan agreed on targeting different households to prevent any overlapping and decided to keep the coordination high in the field staff level while implementing the project. ANNEX 10 IRD identified Azaz and Afrin sub-districts as the relocation plan's target if any was need
